author: editorial-team@simplywallst.com (Simply Wall St)
title: Insider Buying: Wilmar International Co-Founder Bought US$1.1m Of Shares
text:
Simply Wall St. Insider Buying: Wilmar International Co-Founder Bought US$1.1m Of Shares Read full article Oops! Something went wrong. Please try again later. More content below Oops! Something went wrong. Please try again later. More content below F34.SI WLMIY editorial-team@simplywallst.com (Simply Wall St) March 1, 2024 at 12:10 AM · 3 min read In this article: Oops! Something went wrong. Please try again later. More content below Oops! Something went wrong. Please try again later. More content below F34.SI Watchlist WLMIY
Wilmar International Limited ( SGX:F34 ) shareholders (or potential shareholders) will be happy to see that the Co-Founder, Khoon Hong Kuok, recently bought a whopping S$1.1m worth of stock, at a price of S$3.32. While that only increased their holding size by 0.08%, it is still a big swing by our standards.
View our latest analysis for Wilmar International
Wilmar International Insider Transactions Over The Last Year Notably, that recent purchase by Co-Founder Khoon Hong Kuok was not the only time they bought Wilmar International shares this year. They previously made an even bigger purchase of S$15m worth of shares at a price of S$3.69 per share. That means that even when the share price was higher than S$3.32 (the recent price), an insider wanted to purchase shares. Their view may have changed since then, but at least it shows they felt optimistic at the time. In our view, the price an insider pays for shares is very important. It is encouraging to see an insider paid above the current price for shares, as it suggests they saw value, even at higher levels. The only individual insider to buy over the last year was Khoon Hong Kuok.
Khoon Hong Kuok bought 18.12m shares over the last 12 months at an average price of S$3.67. You can see a visual depiction of insider transactions (by companies and individuals) over the last 12 months, below. If you click on the chart, you can see all the individual transactions, including the share price, individual, and the date!
insider-trading-volume Wilmar International is not the only stock that insiders are buying. For those who like to find winning investments this free list of growing companies with recent insider purchasing, could be just the ticket.
Insider Ownership For a common shareholder, it is worth checking how many shares are held by company insiders. I reckon it's a good sign if insiders own a significant number of shares in the company. It's great to see that Wilmar International insiders own 6.8% of the company, worth about S$1.4b. I like to see this level of insider ownership, because it increases the chances that management are thinking about the best interests of shareholders.
Story continues So What Do The Wilmar International Insider Transactions Indicate? The recent insider purchase is heartening. And the longer term insider transactions also give us confidence. Once you factor in the high insider ownership, it certainly seems like insiders are positive about Wilmar International. That's what I like to see! So while it's helpful to know what insiders are doing in terms of buying or selling, it's also helpful to know the risks that a particular company is facing. At Simply Wall St, we've found that Wilmar International has 3 warning signs (1 is concerning!) that deserve your attention before going any further with your analysis.
Of course Wilmar International may not be the best stock to buy . So you may wish to see this free collection of high quality companies.
For the purposes of this article, insiders are those individuals who report their transactions to the relevant regulatory body. We currently account for open market transactions and private dispositions of direct interests only, but not derivative transactions or indirect interests.
Have feedback on this article? Concerned about the content? Get in touch with us directly. Alternatively, email editorial-team (at) simplywallst.com.

author: PR Newswire (Canada)
title: Le laxisme d'ArcelorMittal en santé et sécurité dénoncé sur la planète
text:
Les syndicats représentants les travailleur.euse.s de la multinationale tiennent une journée d'action à travers le monde
MONTRÉAL , le 13 sept. 2024 /CNW/ - Tous les syndicats représentant des travailleur.euse.s dans les différentes installations d'ArcelorMittal à travers le monde, réunis au sein du syndicat mondial IndustriALL, unissent leurs voix pour dénoncer le laxisme d'ArcelorMittal en santé et sécurité.
On a compté au moins 314 travailleur.euse.s décédé.e.s dans les installations d'ArcelorMittal depuis 2012, et les syndicats soupçonnent que ce nombre est sous-évalué.
« Lorsqu'on échange entre les syndicats d'ArcelorMittal, on voit un pattern généralisé : les profits passent avant la santé et la sécurité des travailleurs. Résultat, des travailleur.euse.s perdent leur vie, d'autres sont blessés et on préfère demander aux travailleur.euse.s de porter des équipements de protection individuels plutôt que d'investir pour assainir les milieux de travail », dénonce le directeur québécois des Métallos, Dominic Lemieux .
Il déplore notamment les retards dans les investissements à venir à l'usine de traitement du minerai de la mine du Mont-Wright à Fermont .
Pourtant, la multinationale avait consenti à créer un Comité conjoint global sur la santé et la sécurité en 2007, à la suite d'un accident qui a causé la mort de 41 mineurs au Kazakhstan . Mais celui-ci a cessé ses travaux en personne depuis la pandémie et n'a jamais repris ses travaux, pire, aucune inspection de site n'a eu lieu depuis.
Les syndicats représentant les travailleur.euse.s d'ArcelorMittal à travers le monde, réunis au sein d'IndustriALL, considèrent que la compagnie « presse le citron de ses installations actuelles, plutôt que de moderniser et d'améliorer ses façons de faire pour mieux protéger la santé et sécurité. Cela mène à des accidents et des décès prévisibles et évitables. »
« Cette attitude négligente doit cesser! », tonne le directeur québécois des Métallos, Dominic Lemieux . « La santé et la sécurité, ce n'est pas juste de faire porter des équipements de sécurité et de donner des petits discours d'encouragement au sujet des pratiques sécuritaires. Ça signifie aussi pour la compagnie de mettre la main à la poche pour améliorer réellement les environnements de travail. ArcelorMittal doit reprendre avec plus de sérieux le travail paritaire en santé et sécurité, localement et internationalement, avec les syndicats », conclut Dominic Lemieux .
Le Syndicat des Métallos, affilié à la FTQ, est le plus important syndicat du secteur privé au Québec. Il regroupe plus de 60 000 travailleurs et travailleuses de tous les secteurs économiques.
Pour consulter nos communiqués : https://www.metallos.org/actualites-et-medias/actualites/
Pour suivre notre page Facebook : www.facebook.com/SyndicatDesMetallos/
SOURCE Syndicat des Métallos (FTQ)
Copyright 2024 Canada NewsWire

author: 网易
title: 中美谈完，特朗普虚荣心作祟，称对华关税55%，被白宫一盆水浇醒|华盛顿|社交平台|唐纳·川普|唐纳德·特朗普_网易订阅
text:
中美谈完，特朗普虚荣心作祟，称对华关税55%，被白宫一盆水浇醒
自由的艺术家F
用时两天，中国和美国在伦敦谈完了，事后双方都表示签订了框架协议，将继续按照日内瓦协议履行，就在形势一片大好的时候，偏偏这个时候好大喜功的特朗普出来了。发文评价中美关税谈判进程。
在贴文中，特朗普虚荣心作祟，首先强调了和中方的协议已经达成，随后他表示美国获得了55%的关税，但是中国只获得了10%，同时他还指出根据协议达成的内容，美国将不会为难中国的留学生。
单看看特朗普的帖文，让人不禁想问，中国为什么要签订这样的协议如此不平等呢？就在大家疑惑不已的时候，白宫立马出来辟谣，当场给特朗普泼了一盆凉水。
1、特朗普说55%关税，包含日内瓦的30%，同时还有上一届美国总统的留下来的25%，特朗普虚荣心作祟，两者加到一块，所以就有了55%的数字。
与此同时特朗普再一次不改商人狡诈的做法。在提到对美关税10%的时候，他并没有加上中国的两次反制。而他这样做的目的就是为了在社交平台创造一种美国赢了在谈判中占有主导的位置。而对于特朗普故意带到舆论，中方深知特朗普的为人，好大喜功，这样发文是出于美国国内政治的需要，所以就没和他辩解
不过随后特朗普在接受电视台记者采访的时候，也回到了真诚的一面，感叹中方是一个不容易对付的对手，这么多年中方已经习惯了，在和美国谈判中取得胜利，所以和中国的谈判真的非常的难。这倒是说了一句真真切切的实话，中方一直秉持着公平公正双方互利原则处理谈判相关事宜。
根据 华盛顿 媒体报导中美谈判结束之后，中国恢复向美国发放汽车制造商和工业企业发放稀土出口许可证，但将许可证有效期限制为六个月。
作为交换，华盛顿同意放宽对中国飞机发动机及其零部件以及乙烷的供应限制。
怎么说呢中美谈判，无论结果好坏，基本上都困不住中方，为什么这么讲呢？特朗普的关税政策其实是伤敌百自损一千，他禁止12个国家入境美国的同时，中方给53个非洲国家实施0关税。一个在闭关锁国。一个在广交全世界好友扩大经济贸易范围。无论是在为人处事以及格局上，中国早就和美国不是同一个格局了，所以到底谁胜谁负大家一目了然

author: Tom Gorski
title: Inside Jaden McDuffie's Commitment: Why Northwestern Was The Right Fit
text:
Jaden McDuffie didn't wait for the fall to make a decision.
The three-star wide receiver officially announced his commitment to Northwestern on May 22 via X, giving the program another promising piece in the Wildcats' 2026 recruiting class ahead of his senior season.
The Maryland native joins a Northwestern football program that is steadily building under head coach David Braun. McDuffie offers size and versatility as a wide receiver, with the coaching staff excited about his ability to make an impact on offense.
McDuffie was recruited by Northwestern wide receivers coach Armon Binns and ultimately chose the Wildcats over offers from schools including Air Force, Navy, Toledo, and Georgetown.
Binns was instrumental in McDuffie's recruitment, with their relationship beginning through early conversations on social media.
"He hit me up and was like 'I love your tape' and we hopped on the phone and I felt a connection with him more than I have with most coaches," McDuffie said of the recruiting process. "Everything felt free and fluid and he's also a Lakers fan, so that helped since we went through the playoff loss together."
As a LeBron James fan, McDuffie acknowledged he'll be entering Michael Jordan territory near Chicago and was adamant that James is the greatest of all-time, but will embrace the debate and is more than ready to fight for his guy.
"I'm prepared and I'll fight for my life for LeBron," McDuffie said. "On my official visit, I was going to every single coach and I'll do that every day. I'll wake up at 6 am and text coach 'LeBron is better than Jordan' and whatever it takes, even if it's over the next four-to-five years, I'll be arguing for sure."
Aside from going back and forth with coaches and players on the LeBron vs. Jordan debate, McDuffie said the coaching staff, program culture, and the chance to play in the Big Ten were major factors in his decision.
"I don't see a better place for me than Northwestern as a high academic athlete," McDuffie said of his decision. "It's the best of both worlds and it doesn't get better than that as you're playing in the Big Ten and you're on TV every weekend against the best competition and you get a chance to go to the league if you play well."
While standing at 6-foot-3, McDuffie projects as a big-bodied outside receiver at the X position, but the Wildcats see more than just size. What stands out to the coaching staff is his ability to stretch the field and make plays over the middle — a role they discussed with him during his official visit.
"I feel like they want to stretch the field and have a big target guy with the ability to go across the middle of the field and make a play," McDuffie said of his fit within the offense. "They said they want playmakers and guys who take advantage of the opportunities we give them. That sounds like stuff I can do."
McDuffie walked away from his visit with more than just a good feeling — he left with a plan.
Braun, Binns, and offensive coordinator Zach Lujan outlined how McDuffie would be developed from day one, with a clear vision for his development over the first two seasons and a long-term plan that extends through all five years if he stays for a full college career.
"We mainly talked about where they see me for my freshman and sophomore year and how they're going to help me reach my potential," McDuffie said. "Coach Bims in the meeting showed me where I would be and how I can make an impact. They really showed what they have in store for me and a plan for me to make it to the next level and become the best version of myself."
Coming off a breakout junior season at South River High School in Maryland, McDuffie caught 73 passes and set a school record with 1,251 receiving yards, adding 17 touchdowns over 10 games and averaging 125 yards per contest.
His jump in production from sophomore to junior year was significant — a leap he credits to both a shift in the team's offensive approach and his own physical development.
McDuffie said the team rarely threw the ball during his first two seasons, but that changed as a junior when the coaching staff expanded the playbook and made getting him more touches a priority.
With the passing game expanding, McDuffie quickly emerged as a key target and driving force behind the offense's progress. An offseason growth spurt only added to his ability to make an impact.
Reflecting on his development, McDuffie said he approached the game like a mathematician — constantly calculating where defenders would move and staying fully locked in while studying film.
"I hit my growth spurt and now I'm like 6-foot-3 now, but I took all aspects of my game to the next level and worked on my athletic ability," McDuffie said. "I really wanted to work on my craft and just combine all aspects of my game from the years of playing football and it came out this year on the scene."
With his college decision behind him, McDuffie has one focus heading into his senior season: bringing home a state title.
"One thing I really want to do is win a state championship," he said. "In my town, we're not really known as a football school, and I want to change that. A lot of kids in middle school think they have to go private to get noticed. So for my final year, I want to blow up, win a state championship, and show them you can stay home and still make it."
